cellularAutomata.graphics
Class InitialStatesPanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  cellularAutomata.graphics.InitialStatesPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.event.ChangeListener, javax.swing.event.DocumentListener
public class InitialStatesPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, javax.swing.event.DocumentListener, javax.swing.event.ChangeListener

The JPanel/tab that contains all of the initial state choices such as blank, random, etc.

Author:
David Bahr
See Also:
Serialized Form

resetActiveRadioButton

public void resetActiveRadioButton()
Resets the radio button. For example, a new rule might necessitate this because some initial states may no longer be accessible.

resetRectangleSpinners

public void resetRectangleSpinners()
Reset the rectangle's width and height spinner models so that they reflect the current size of the lattice.

setActiveRadioButton

public void setActiveRadioButton(java.lang.String initialStateName)
Selects the radio button that has the supplied name. If that name doesn't exist, it is set to the default blank initial state.

Parameters:
initialStateName - The name of the initial state, for example CAPropertyReader.STATE_BLANK or the value stored in CAPropertyReader.INIT_STATE.

updateRuleGeneratedInitialStates

public void updateRuleGeneratedInitialStates()
Change the radio buttons to reflect the latest selected rule (each rule can generate a list of initial states).
